pigeonhole.translation[0].definitions[0]: one of a set of small open boxes fixed to a wall. You leave letters, messages etc for particular people in the boxes.
pigeonhole.translation[1].definitions[0]: to unfairly consider a person, activity etc as belonging to a particular type or group
Patsy was pigeonholed as a Country and Western singer, but thatâ€™s too simple.
pigeonhole.translation[2].definitions[0]: to consider a person, activity etc as belonging to a particular type or group, in a way that is too simple and therefore unfair
Electronic books and multimedia had originally been pigeonholed as a small, exclusive market.
pigeonhole.translation[3].definitions[0]: one of a set of small boxes in a frame on a wall, in which you can put letters etc for people to collect, or one of a set of small boxes that are part of a desk
I left a copy of the report in your pigeonhole.
